What is a design system?

In one line: A design system is a guidelines/patterns/style guide for the products that we develop in the frontend, mobile apps ordesktop apps etc.

Examples for design systems are:
  • Atlassian Design
  • Cosmos

Today, we will be talking about how to get started with design systems in ReactJS using , Styled Components and StorybooksJS.

StorybooksJS indeed supports different frontend frameworks like VueJS, Ember, Angular, Svelte etc. But for todayâ€™s purpose we will be using ReactJS.

Prerequisite

  1. Create React App.
  2. Styled Components.
  3. StorybooksJS
  4. Jest & React Testing Library.
  5. Netlify Account (I am using netlify for hosting site you can use whatever you like).

Step 1:

Lets start by creating a react application using below command in Create React App.

npx create-react-app react-design-system

Step 2:

Add styled-components in package.json.

npm install styled-components --dev

Step 3:

Now we have a react application with styled components to create react design system.

So let us start by creating a <Button> component.

import React from 'react';
import styled from 'styled-components';

// Our button is going have two types primary & secondary
const APPEARANCES = { primary: 'primary', secondary: 'secondary' };

// Appearances style
const primaryStyle = ``;
const secondaryStyle = ``;

// Disabled style
const disabledStyle = ``;

// Button element
const ButtonElement = styled.button`
	appearence: none;
	border-radius: 3px;
	border: none;
	cursor: pointer;
	font-weight: 500;
	margin: 0 12px;
	outline: none;

	${({ appearance }) => (appearance === APPEARANCES.primary ? primaryStyle : secondaryStyle)};

	${({ disabled }) => disabled && disabledStyle};
`;

const Button = ({ appearance, children, disabled, onClick }) => {
	return (
		<ButtonElement appearance={appearance} disabled={disabled} onClick={onClick}>
			{children}
		</ButtonElement>
	);
};

export { APPEARANCES };
export default Button;

Step 4:

Add storybook & its addon for react in package.json.

npm install @storybook/react @storybook/addon-info --dev

And add this script in package.json scripts section to run storybook.

"build-storybook": "build-storybook -c .storybook -o .out"

Step 5:

Lets create Button.stories.js file for out <Button> component.

import React from 'react';
import { storiesOf } from '@storybook/react';

import Button, { APPEARANCES } from './Button';

storiesOf('Button', module).add('appearances', () => (
	<React.Fragment>
		{Object.values(APPEARANCES).map(appearance => (
			<Button appearance={appearance} key={appearance} onClick={() => {}}>
				{appearance}
			</Button>
		))}
	</React.Fragment>
));

Demo

Step 6: (Finally step)

Lets write some unit tests using react-testing-library in Button.test.js.

npm install @testing-library/react @testing-library/jest-dom jest-styled-components --dev

Actual test file.

import '@testing-library/jest-dom/extend-expect';
import 'jest-styled-components';

import React from 'react';
import { render, fireEvent } from '@testing-library/react';

import Button, { APPEARANCES } from './Button';
import variables from '../variables'; // We have stored some the common styles in this file as variable

describe('Button', () => {
	const onClickMock = jest.fn();
	const btnText = 'Click me';

	it(`should render the component`, () => {
		const { getByText } = render(<Button onClick={onClickMock}>{btnText}</Button>);
		expect(getByText(btnText)).toBeInTheDocument();
	});

	it('should trigger click event', () => {
		const { getByText } = render(<Button onClick={onClickMock}>{btnText}</Button>);
		fireEvent.click(getByText(btnText));
		expect(onClickMock).toHaveBeenCalled();
	});

	describe('appearances', () => {
		it(`should render the component with ${APPEARANCES.primary} appearance`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(<Button onClick={onClickMock}>{btnText}</Button>);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('background-color', variables.backgroundColors.primary);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('color', variables.colors.white);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '6px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.normal);
		});

		it(`should render the component with ${APPEARANCES.primary} appearance`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(<Button onClick={onClickMock}>{btnText}</Button>);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('background-color', variables.backgroundColors.primary);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('color', variables.colors.white);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '6px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.normal);
		});
	});

	describe('sizes', () => {
		it(`should render the component with ${SIZES.normal} size`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(<Button onClick={onClickMock}>{btnText}</Button>);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '6px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.normal);
		});

		it(`should render the component with ${SIZES.medium} size`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(
				<Button onClick={onClickMock} size={SIZES.medium}>
					{btnText}
				</Button>
			);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '8px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.medium);
		});

		it(`should render the component with ${SIZES.large} size`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(
				<Button onClick={onClickMock} size={SIZES.large}>
					{btnText}
				</Button>
			);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '10px 16px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.large);
		});
	});

	describe('shapes', () => {
		it(`should render the component ${SIZES.normal} size and ${SHAPE.round} shape`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(
				<Button onClick={onClickMock} shape={SHAPE.round}>
					{btnText}
				</Button>
			);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '0');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('border-radius', variables.borderRadius.round);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.normal);
		});

		it(`should render the component ${SIZES.medium} size and ${SHAPE.round} shape`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(
				<Button onClick={onClickMock} shape={SHAPE.round} size={SIZES.medium}>
					{btnText}
				</Button>
			);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '0');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('border-radius', variables.borderRadius.round);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.medium);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('width', '35px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('height', '35px');
		});

		it(`should render the component ${SIZES.large} size and ${SHAPE.round} shape`, () => {
			const { getByText } = render(
				<Button onClick={onClickMock} shape={SHAPE.round} size={SIZES.large}>
					{btnText}
				</Button>
			);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('padding', '0');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('border-radius', variables.borderRadius.round);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('font-size', variables.fontSizes.large);
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('width', '45px');
			expect(getByText(btnText)).toHaveStyleRule('height', '45px');
		});
	});
});
